themes: Underfunding of music and film sectors
Economic impact of local artists vs. convention center
Recognition of artists' contributions to Austin's identity
Desire for Austin to be a top destination for artists
key_phrases: more money go to individual artists and organizations in the music and film industries
A *majority* of our HOT taxes go to a convention center that serves only 300,000 visitors per year
Filmmakers and musicians bring in MILLIONS of tourists and generate MILLIONS of jobs
redistribute financial support from failed corporate interests like the ACC to the artists, festivals, and museums who keep Austin weird, creative, and thriving
barriers_identified: Imbalance in HOT tax allocation favoring convention center over artists
Financial support directed to 'failed corporate interests' instead of cultural sectors
solutions_proposed: Redistribute financial support from the convention center (ACC) to artists, festivals, and museums
Increase funding for individual artists and organizations in the music and film industries
